sanskrit_verse:
ब्राह्मणस्य रुजः कृत्वा  घ्रातिरघ्रेयमद्ययोः ।
जैह्म्यं च मैथुनं पुंसि जातिभ्रंशकरं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.६७॥
transliteration:
brāhmaṇasya rujaḥ kṛtvā ghrātiraghreyamadyayoḥ |
jaihmyaṃ ca maithunaṃ puṃsi jātibhraṃśakaraṃ smṛtam || 11.67 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Causing injury to a Brāhmaṇa, consuming alcohol, engaging in prohibited sexual acts — these actions result in loss of varṇic alignment and constitute a breakdown of conscious capacity.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from sustained alignment with Dharma, not birth alone
Causation is established through disruption of consciousness-field integrity
Capacity-based responsibility requires restoration of spiritual-social function
Restoration logic prioritizes reintegration into dharmic order over punitive exclusion
Consciousness alignment determines eligibility for societal participation
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent causes physical harm to individual identified as Brāhmaṇa THEN initiate consciousness-restoration protocol
IF agent consumes intoxicants THEN assess disruption to cognitive-vibrational clarity AND assign purification regimen
IF agent engages in proscribed sexual conduct THEN evaluate impact on lineage-consciousness continuity AND mandate realignment process
IF act results in loss of varṇic alignment THEN invoke community-guided reintegration sequence
IF agent demonstrates restored capacity THEN acknowledge completion AND reinstate functional role
supreme_court_application: Supreme judicial authority must determine the degree of disruption caused to the consciousness field of the affected Brāhmaṇa and society at large. Responsibility thresholds are calibrated based on intent, awareness, and capacity for restoration rather than punitive attribution. Restoration precedes legal resolution.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that injury, intoxication, and improper union disrupt sequential manifestation of dharma. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how misaligned action leads to disconnection from source-consciousness. Proportional responsibility lies in reversing the causal chain without inflicting suffering. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that true justice restores harmony, not vengeance.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate ritual-cognitive purification to restore vibrational clarity
Assign service to sacred knowledge centers to rebuild dharmic resonance
Undertake guided prāṇāyama and mantra-dhyāna to realign consciousness
Engage in community accountability circles to reaffirm social-dharma commitment
Complete vrata-based discipline to regenerate spiritual capacity
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands executed. Justice flows as restoration. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness reigns as the ultimate adjudicator.
